functions

Class Editor

  • java.lang.Object
    • functions.Editor

  • public class Editor
extends java.lang.Object
    The Editor class provides functionality to edit the values in a Table.

    This class allows for modifying the value of a specific cell in the table by specifying the row and column indices. The new value is parsed and set using the TypeChecker associated with the table. 

     
 Table table = new Table(new TypeChecker());
 // Populate table with rows and cells
 Editor editor = new Editor(table);
 editor.edit(0, 1, 42);
    Since:
    2024-06-24

    • Method Detail

      • edit

        public void edit(int row,
                 int column,
                 java.lang.Object newValue)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Edits the value of a specific cell in the table.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the cell to be edited
        column - the column index of the cell to be edited
        newValue - the new value to be set in the cell
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the specified row or column does not exist
